Class ObjectPool<T>

java.lang.Object
com.example.demo.utils.ObjectPool<T>
Type Parameters:
T - The type of objects managed by this pool.
public class ObjectPool<T> extends Object
A generic object pool implementation that reuses objects to minimize resource allocation and enhance performance.

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description
    private final Deque<T>
    available
    A deque (double-ended queue) to store available objects for reuse.
    private final ObjectFactory<T>
    factory
    The factory responsible for creating and resetting objects managed by the pool.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    ObjectPool(ObjectFactory<T> factory)
    Constructs an ObjectPool with the specified factory.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    T
    acquire()
    Acquires an object from the pool.
    void
    release(T obj)
    Releases an object back to the pool, resetting it to its initial state.

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Field Details

    • available

      private final Deque<T> available
      A deque (double-ended queue) to store available objects for reuse.

    • factory

      private final ObjectFactory<T> factory
      The factory responsible for creating and resetting objects managed by the pool.

  • Constructor Details

    • ObjectPool

      public ObjectPool(ObjectFactory<T> factory)
      Constructs an ObjectPool with the specified factory.
      Parameters:
      factory - The factory used to create and reset objects for the pool.

  • Method Details

    • acquire

      public T acquire()
      Acquires an object from the pool. If the pool is empty, a new object is created using the factory.
      Returns:
      An object of type T from the pool, either reused or newly created.

    • release

      public void release(T obj)
      Releases an object back to the pool, resetting it to its initial state. This ensures the object is ready for reuse in subsequent operations.
      Parameters:
      obj - The object to be returned to the pool.
